etymologies: mid 18th century: from Bengali jhūṭo ‘matted hair’, from Prakrit juṣṭi

definitions: rough fiber made from the stems of a tropical Old World plant, used for making twine and rope or woven into sacking or matting.
shortDefinitions: rough fibre made from stems of tropical Old World plant

definitions: the herbaceous plant which is cultivated for jute fiber, with edible young shoots.

notes.text: Genus Corchorus, family Tiliaceae: several species, in particular C. capsularis of China and C. olitorius of India

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant which is cultivated for this fibre, with edible young shoots

definitions: used in names of other plants that yield fiber, e.g. Chinese jute.
shortDefinitions: used in names of other plants that yield fibre
